## SDQ vs ARBQ

Comparing the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ) and the Anxiety-Related Behaviours Questionnaire (ARBQ) provides insightful data for psychologists and social scientists alike. However, the process of harmonising these two questionnaires can be time-consuming and intricate. That's where Harmony comes in handy; providing an efficient and user-friendly solution to this administrative challenge. Harmony, a software developed specifically for psychologists, uses advanced algorithms and natural language processing to compare instruments like the SDQ and ARBQ. By providing a percentage match between each item in the SDQ and ARBQ, psychologists can conduct comprehensive cross-study analysis, aid in producing more reliable and conclusive research results. The term SDQ vs ARBQ takes on new meaning when using Harmony to understand behavioural differences more deeply. Embrace the power of technology in the field of psychology and social sciences. Use Harmony for the SDQ vs ARBQ comparison and improve the objectivity and speed of your research process. By selecting instruments from Harmony's database or by uploading your own PDFs through Harmony's web interface, comparing SDQ vs ARBQ has never been easier. Harmonising data across different questionnaires and in multiple languages is now at the tip of your fingers with Harmony.

## Compare the items in SDQ and ARBQ

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import SDQ and ARBQ into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SDQ into Harmony</a> - compare SDQ with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just ARBQ into Harmony</a> - compare ARBQ with other instruments
